subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. Here is
what happened. This is a story and I really
think it is interesting. You see, I walked
into this room only about 10 minutes ago
or less with the idea of making a very
different kind of video. It was going
to be a video focused on the topic of:
should parapsychology change its name?
Really, I’m not dead set against
it. Whatever happens will happen.
Names do change. But I have an
investment in parapsychology. So, as I was
walking in here thinking about doing
that video, I had a thought. The
thought was: don't do this. I did a
quick little thing that I do sometimes
with autonomic muscle movements, where
I’ll say, “OK, let me check at a
deeper level with myself about that. If
it's a yes answer my right forefinger
will go up. If it’s a no answer it’ll be
my left forefinger.” I just wait and
boom, you know, up came no. So, I walked out,
I just walked right out of the room into
the hallway. Then I thought, isn't
that interesting, a thought came into my
mind and on the basis of that thought, I
took an action. Then I began
pondering the nature of thought itself:
how thought leads to action, how a
thought just appeared in my conscious
mind. It bubbled up from somewhere,
my subconscious, my super conscious, but
then the thought was: go back in. Go back
in, you’ve got a story to tell here. It's
not about should parapsychology change
its name, it’s about watching a thought
, watching what a thought can do. So, my
ability just then to watch that thought
come up changed my agenda.
Then I walked out of the room and
then another thought. Once again,
the agenda changed and here I am now. But
to be honest, I feel like I’m up against
a wall, up against a dead end. Like, how
much further can I push this topic? Where
did that thought come from? Sometimes
when I feel stuck like this, the reason
is because I’m not asking the right
question of myself. Asking the
right question of myself can almost
always lead to a breakthrough. That is a
fresh insight. Of course, I’ve been
asking questions most of my professional
life, but it's the questions I ask myself
that are probably the most important.
That could be another “In Presence” lesson.
What are the questions you are asking
yourself? Are we asking ourselves the
right questions? The questions that are
going to make us bigger, make us more
wholesome... wholesome. But you know, I can
push a word, I can push a topic. What does
wholesome mean? What does it mean to ask
oneself a question? What does it do when
you ask a question? How does that affect
consciousness, the asking of and the
hearing of questions? These are really
basic issues that I have hardly given
any thought to at all. What is the impact
of asking a question, of formulating a
question on the consciousness of the
questioner? And what is the impact of
hearing such a question in the
consciousness of the listener, or in this
case, maybe the viewer? One of the things
that I would like to share is the idea
of live streaming. What would that be
like?
It would mean you’d
be with me in real time, instead of
simulated time. It would mean you
could ask a question, pose a question -
I’m pretty sure there is a feature now on
live streaming that allows the viewers
to interact by typing in questions that
appear. I don't know where they appear, I
haven't done it yet, but I’m going to
research it. I’m intrigued as
to what can be done in terms of live-
streaming with this group.You know, I’m
getting a thought now, a memory of before
I began speaking as I was sitting in
this chair having a moment of silence
before going on air - typically 15 seconds
of silence because that gives me enough
time to filter out the background noise,
the air conditioning sounds, to give you
really good quality audio. I do it every
time. Although sometimes static or
something comes through, I can't get rid
of it all, but that's very rare. Mostly
you're getting good fidelity audio. The
point being however, I use that moment,
the 15 seconds or so, I said to myself,
closing my eyes, OK, time to go into
higher consciousness mode and it was
like,
wooooooo
o…. open up as high as you can go in the
next 15 seconds or so. It was like that.
Now, the question is: did that work? I
think it may have. What does it say to
you? Here’s one thing it
says: just by a thought you can
shift your consciousness. Isn't that what
this is about,
ultimately? Isn't that the notion that
brings all of this together: by a single
thought you can shift your consciousness.
That is such a profound insight. What
could be easier than a single thought?
Knowing that you can shift your
consciousness with a single thought? What
power there is in that idea. That is an
idea that deserves to be widely
communicated. I would love to have
everybody in the world understand that.
You can shift your consciousness with
a thought. That is very powerful, it
is very empowering. I did, I walked into
this room with the idea of doing one
video. I changed my mind, I walked out.
Then I changed my mind again and walked
back in, full of inspiration. I didn't
even know exactly what but I knew it was
going to go somewhere. There is so much power,
there is so much to be said. Sometimes I
feel like I have nothing to say, but the
truth is, I just need to ask myself the
right question because you can shift
your consciousness with a single thought.
And I'll leave you with that thought.
Thank you for being with me because this
is going to be shared.
[credits]
